meanings.definition: To disturb persistently; torment, as with troubles or cares
meanings.sent1: The noisy neighbors would constantly harass us with their loud music.
meanings.sent2: The bullies would harass the younger students on the playground every day.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel would harass the birds by stealing their food.
meanings.sent4: The relentless rain would harass the farmers, causing their crops to flood.
meanings.sent5: The persistent mosquito would harass me all night, buzzing in my ear.

meanings.definition: To trouble by repeated attacks; annoy persistently
meanings.sent1: The persistent telemarketer would harass me with multiple phone calls every day.
meanings.sent2: The paparazzi would harass the celebrity outside her house, trying to get a photo.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy would harass the older dog by constantly nipping at its tail.
meanings.sent4: The strong winds would harass the fragile tent, threatening to blow it away.
meanings.sent5: The annoying alarm clock would harass me every morning, waking me up abruptly.

meanings.definition: To create an unpleasant or hostile situation for, especially by uninvited and unwelcome verbal or physical conduct
meanings.sent1: The online troll would harass other users with hurtful comments and messages.
meanings.sent2: The aggressive salesperson would harass customers into buying products they didn't need.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat would harass the dog by swatting at its tail.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds would harass the sky, threatening to bring a storm.
meanings.sent5: The persistent cough would harass me during the quiet movie, drawing annoyed glances.
